comment: Her speech delivery. Her explanations are so simple and direct, I love it. She explained EVERY tiny thing, literally. Highly appreciate that she always took the time to respond to us one on one and also include the rest of the class so that They learn something by the interaction as well.

She is amazing professor who cares about students' Learning. If I know anything about ML or python, it is due to her. She makes sure everybody's on the same page before moving on to the next topic and the way she explains everything, if you pay attention, you can learn everything. Absolute best wished for her.

Her lectures and course materials were generally clear and well-organized, which helped me follow along and understand the material effectively.I found her to be accessible and responsive to inquiries, whether through office hours, email, or during class discussions. Her prompt responses and willingness to clarify concepts were greatly appreciated.
The professor effectively taught and assisted students in understanding the course material.
Dr. Vyas was very communicative, accessible, encouraging, and pragmatic, which made it easy to focus on learning.
Professor provided various material's (slides, kahoots etc) to understand the topics and also I like the way Professor explained the topics.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment:
I really appreciate the interactive discussions. The course content was relevant and engaging. The professor was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the topics, which
enhanced my learning experience. I liked how she provided access to class lectures for online students, making it easier to stay connected and keep up with the course material.

I had this professor for my IT Policy and Law class.  The course is not particular difficult but requires a lot of your time due to the number of discussions, group projects and papers.  She is not particularly difficult, but appears a little bit disconnected. from the course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Poor class quality. Doesn't provide original lectures. Relies on youtube videos to teach class. Lab heavy but lacks sufficient lab access and communication. Grading takes a long time as well. Course requires self-teaching.
